metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10745 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in all Samba versions before 4.10.17, before 4.11.11 and before 4.12.4 in the way it processed NetBios over TCP/IP. This flaw allows a remote attacker could to cause the Samba server to consume excessive CPU use, resulting in a denial of service. This highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10745` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: samba package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm7').
